question: September 2016 - Question 172 Effective health counseling skills are a critical component of meeting the educational needs of patients and families and providing expert coaching and guidance for people who are managing diabetes on a daily basis. Health counseling includes skills such as effectively providing information, counseling patients about available options, and helping them make well-informed decisions through a client-centered approach. A positive interaction between the clinical nurse specialist (CNS) and the patient can have a positive effect on diabetes management. The CNS can help to make the interaction positive by showing sensitivity to the patient and by having empathy and understanding of the patient's feeling, which will also enhance patient satisfaction. Another approach to improving adherence is to establish a therapeutic contract with the patient in which the patient and provider work together to set goals, assign responsibilities, and set a date for attaining the goal. Research has shown that positive lifestyle change for people with diabetes is facilitated by long-term, collaborative relationships with healthcare providers. Further, long-term follow-up with regular reinforcement is most effective for sustaining change in diet and physical activity, which have been identified as the first and the second most difficult behaviors for people with diabetes to change. The passage is mainly about ..........
options: attending to educational needs of diabetics

question: September 2016 - Question 173 Based on the presented information while counseling, CNS must consider the ..........
options: collaboration with other healthcare providers and consolers
importance of psychological and environmental factors
answerText: importance of psychological and environmental factors

question: September 2016 - Question 174 A client-centered approach is based on ..........
options: working together to achieve the set goals

question: September 2016 - Question 175 The word 'adherence' refers to the ..........

interaction between patients and care providers
answerText: interaction between patients and care providers

question: September 2016 - Question 176 One area of difficulty experienced by diabetic patients is ..........

answerText: making lifestyle changes and maintaining them

March 2017 - Question 172 Read the following passage carefully and by selecting the one item -a,b,c, or d- appropriately complete the statements which follow. Then mark your answer sheet.

The prevalence of asymptomatic microscopic hematuria in adults ranges from 0.19 to 21 percent. The range is wide because of differing definition of clinically significant microscopic hematuria and varying ages of the study populations. Urine normally contains a few red blood cells, and microscopic hematuria generally is defined as one to 10 red blood cells per high-power field of urine sediment. The American Urological Association (AUA) defines clinically significant microscopic hematuria as three or more red blood cells per high-power field on microscopic evaluation of urinary sediment from two of three properly collected urinalysis specimens. Each laboratory, however, establishes its own thresholds based on the method of detection used and in reference to healthy persons as controls. Urine dipstick evaluation may be misleading because it lacks the ability to distinguish red blood cells from myoglobin or hemoglobin. Therefore, a positive finding of microscopic hematuria on urinary dipstick testing required follow-up examination by microscopic technique to confirm the presence of red blood cells. Microscopic hematuria, unlike gross hematuria, is often an incidental finding but may be associated with urologic malignancy in up to 10 percent of adults. Despite the risk, result of recent study revealed that 39 to 90 percent of persons with microscopic hematuria on screening urinalysis received no follow-up testing. Microscopic hematuria presents a challenging clinical scenario for family physicians.

A follow-up examination by microscopic technique may be needed to...........
options: confirm the presence of myoglobin or hemoglobin
confirm the presence of red blood cells
disprove the results of previous findings
ignore the presence of any malignancies
answerText: confirm the presence of red blood cells

question: March 2017 - Question 173 The significance of microscopic hematuria is determined...........
options: on the basis of one properly collected specimen
by urologists using their own criteria

question: March 2017 - Question 174 The underlined word 'thresholds' in line 7 can best be substituted by...........

options: it is a very difficult task to distinguish red blood cells from myoglobin
one properly collected urinalysis specimen never reveals a malignancy
microscopic hematuria is often a symptom of malignancy in the urinary system
microscopic hematuria could be a challenge for family physicians
answerText: microscopic hematuria could be a challenge for family physicians

question: March 2017 - Question 176 All of the following statements are true EXCEPT...........

Hematuria could be a sign of some malignancy.
answerText: Urine normally contains 10 red blood cells per high-power field of urine sediment.

March 2021 - Question 181 English Reading Passage 1: Since the beginning of the COVID-19 outbreak, health care providers have been shown more support than they ever had. Yet, attacks on health care have continuously been reported and include incidents linked to the COVID-19 pandemic across the world. This public health emergency has shown that health facilities, medical transport, and patients as well as health care workers and their families can – and do – become targets everywhere. This alarming trend reinforces the need for improved measures to protect health care personnel from acts of violence. Any verbal or physical act of violence, obstruction, or threat, interfering with the access and delivery of such services is defined as attack on health care systems by the World Health Organization (WHO). What is true about the passage?
options: The COVID-19 can cause violence among patients.
The COVID-19 has caused attacks on the families of patients.
Attacks on health care providers have not stopped during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Health care providers have continuously attacked COVID-19 patients.
answerText: Attacks on health care providers have not stopped during the COVID-19 pandemic.

March 2021 - Question 186 English Reading Passage 2: Diabetes mellitus (DM) is a chronic disease with a global prevalence that continues to grow and is associated with both a significant individual and public health burden. Lifestyle modifications including medical nutritional therapy remain the cornerstones of successful management of DM, in conjunction with glucose-lowering medications when indicated. In addition, education on the principles of physical activity, on the need for self-monitoring of blood glucose, and on the adjustment of appropriate medications during times of illness, for example, are vital to the person with DM. What is true about diabetes mellitus?
options: Diabetes mellitus has already been controlled with recent advances in medicaments.
Diabetes mellitus is still on the rise in spite of recent advances in medicaments.
Diabetes mellitus is limited to certain regions owing to recent advances in medicaments.
Diabetes mellitus has little impact on social health due to recent advances in medicaments.
answerText: Diabetes mellitus is still on the rise in spite of recent advances in medicaments.
